DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : The influenza vaccine may help prevent flu patient undergone stem cell transplant . PURPOSE : This clinical trial study well influenza vaccine work prevent flu patient undergone stem cell transplant healthy volunteer .
DOC.brief_title: Influenza Vaccine Preventing Flu Patients Who Have Undergone Stem Cell Transplant Healthy Volunteers
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - To examine incidence rate influenza infection two flu season patient undergone hematopoietic stem cell transplantation City Hope National Medical Center . - To correlate influenza infection graft-vs-host disease , age , transplant type patient . - To examine compare incidence rate influenza healthy volunteer incidence rate patient . OUTLINE : Beginning approximately 2 week vaccination onset flu season , patient healthy participant undergo nasopharyngeal wash every 14-17 day ( 2-10 wash ) month November-March 2008-2009 2009-2010 flu season . Samples analyze direct fluorescent antibody . Patients participant complete case report form detail flu-like symptom experience 2 week sample collection . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 150 patient 75 healthy volunteer accrue study .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : Meets 1 follow : Patient City Hope Kaiser hospital underwent prior autologous allogeneic matchedrelated hematopoietic stem cell transplantation ( HSCT ) matchedunrelated HSCT treatment hematological malignancy , include aplastic anemia myelodysplastic syndrome Must agree return City Hope screen every 24 week flu season 100365 day posttransplant Any prior therapy allow Employee volunteer City Hope agree nasopharyngeal wash perform General Clinical Research Center every 2 week flu season Must eligible ( per physician instruction ) vaccinate 20082009 20092010 flu season PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : Life expectancy > 9 month PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : See Disease Characteristics
